2.text: Whose assistant are you? Is he weak-minded? And do you sustain the arm of him that is not strong?

3.text: To whom have you given advice? Perhaps it is to him that has no wisdom or prudence that you have revealed your many ideas.

4.text: Who is it that you wanted to teach? Was it not him that created the breath of life?

5.text: Behold, giant things groan under the waters, and they dwell with them.

6.text: The underworld is naked before him, and there is no covering for perdition.

7.text: He stretched out the North over emptiness, and he suspended the land over nothing.

8.text: He secures the waters in his clouds, so that they do not burst forth downward all at once.

9.text: He holds back the face of his throne, and he stretches his cloud over it.

10.text: He has set limits around the waters, until light and darkness shall reach their limit.

11.text: The pillars of heaven tremble and are frightened at his nod.

12.text: By his strength, the seas suddenly gather together, and his foresight has struck the arrogant.

13.text: His spirit has adorned the heavens, and his birthing hand has brought forth the winding serpent.

14.text: Behold, these things have been said about his ways in part, and, since we barely have heard a small drop of his word, who will be able to gaze upon the thunder of his greatness?
